intro.speaker: Eremiya
intro.line: So the Altean army has reclaimed Altea Castle. Master Gharnef is rightfully livid...

intro.speaker: Eremiya
intro.line: And yet, Eine. All you can do is stand there, doing nothing. Are you not ashamed of being alive? To die for my sake-- is that not the natural recourse?

intro.speaker: Eremiya
intro.line: Eine, you are worthless trash. There is no value in your life. You're a child the world never wanted. Tell me, who was it that saved you? Who should you thank for allowing your wretched existence to continue?

intro.speaker: Katarina
intro.line: It's all thanks... to you, Lady Eremiya.

intro.speaker: Eremiya
intro.line: Silence, worthless puppet. You cannot defy my orders. That's what I've "taught" you since you were little. The words I engraved upon your then-young soul will remain there, forever.

intro.speaker: Eremiya
intro.line: O-hoh hoh! I'll use you until you break. My little puppet...

battle.speaker: Marth
battle.line: Katarina, if you have reasons, I would like to hear them. I'm sure we can settle this, without resorting to fighting.

battle.speaker: Katarina
battle.line: ...I'm sorry. I... I have no choice but to do this.

boss-talk.speaker: Katarina
boss-talk.line: That was... That was all... a lie. Everything I did was to deceive you... It was all just a ruse... The truth is... I don't care about you...

boss-talk.speaker: Kris
boss-talk.line: If that's the case... Then why are you crying, now?

boss-talk.speaker: Kris
boss-talk.line: Katarina. You don't belong there. You want to fight alongside me, for Prince Marth. I'm certain of it.

boss-talk.speaker: Katarina
boss-talk.line: It's... too late for that. I've committed too many unforgivable sins...

boss-talk.speaker: Kris
boss-talk.line: Then, you'll just have to start atoning for them. It won't be easy. Many people from both Altea and your organization will turn you a cold shoulder... But, I can promise you this. No matter what happens... I'll stand by your side.

flashback.speaker: Katarina
flashback.line: Kris, that's a wonderful name. We're here for the same reason, then. My name is Katarina. I came because I wish to serve Prince Marth.

flashback.speaker: Katarina
flashback.line: Thank goodness... Kris, you won. I knew you could do it.

flashback.speaker: Katarina
flashback.line: I... I'd like be a Royal Guard, if you're in with me.. Together, we'd be an unstoppable team... When I imagine a future like that, I feel very happy. ...Um, what about you, Kris? Do you, perhaps, feel the same as I...?

boss.speaker: Katarina
boss.line: I am a puppet... I exist only to serve Lady Eremiya... My life has no value...

boss.speaker: Katarina
boss.line: Thank... you... ... Now I... won't have to hurt Kris... anymore... Kris... I'm... glad I could meet you... During those days of training... you showed me a beautiful, happy dream... Hey, Kris... Today's training... is about to begin... Look, there's Prince Marth and the others... Don't... wait for me... ... ...

end.speaker: Katarina
end.line: ...Prince Marth, I have committed many unforgivable sins. Please, hand me punishment... worthy of my crimes. Please execute me...

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: Raise your head, Katarina. I have no intention of taking your life.

end.speaker: Katarina
end.line: But... why? I don't deserve to live. Please let me atone with my death...

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: That's no atonement. You're just running from your sins.

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: If you truly regret what you've done, then live. I want you to atone with your life, not your death.

end.speaker: Katarina
end.line: Atone with my life...? But, how? What should I do...? How could I even begin to atone?

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: I cannot give you that answer. Until now, you've only followed orders, never thinking for yourself. But that's going to change now. You will think for yourself, and find your own answer. That is my punishment to you.

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: Kris... I've forced you to play a painful role. I won't forgive the villain who led her to this path. Let's go, Kris.
